cyclone.name: TAMMY
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles E of Barbados and 385 miles ESE of Guadeloupe
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn NW on Friday and move near or over the Leeward Islands Friday-Saturday before curving northward into the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches/warnings limited to Guadeloupe, Antigua-Barbuda, Montserrat, St. Kitts-Nevis, and nearby northern Windwards/Leewards – not currently the U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same Leeward Islands stretch – no current warning for U.S. Virgin Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Windward Islands, Leeward Islands, British & U.S. Virgin Islands, eastern Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Low–moderate chance (25%) of tropical-storm-force winds, with peak onset Saturday night–Sunday; brief gusts could reach 40–50 mph if outer bands pass close
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected for St. Croix; main 1-3 ft surge threat confined to the Leeward Islands closer to Tammy’s core
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches likely with isolated spots up to 4 inches; localized urban or flash flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells, rough surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Friday and persisting through the weekend
